intro: Epilobium pallidiflorum, commonly known as the paleflower willowherb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and woodland edges. The plant produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and the stems are often reddish in color. Epilobium pallidiflorum is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species like the common willowherb.
